.
Determining the Time Limit for Adverse Action Hearing Requests
As stated in
38 CFR 3.105(i)(1)
, payments continue at their current rate if a beneficiary requests a hearing within 30 days of the date the notice of proposed adverse action is sent.  If the 30-day time limit expires on a Saturday, Sunday, or holiday, include the next succeeding workday in the computation.
Exception
:  For hearings requested in connection with proposed incompetency, a hearing requested at any time prior to the final rating must be held before final rating action is taken.
References
:  For more information on
extending the adverse action proposal period, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.B.1.d
, and
proposed incompetency, see
38 CFR 3.353(e)
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A.3.a
.
